channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: JetBlue flight makes emergency landing from 36k feet in minutes in US
item.description: A JetBlue flight from New York to San Diego made an emergency landing at Salina Regional Airport after pilots received alerts of possible smoke or fire in the cargo bay. The plane descended quickly and landed safely. No fire was detected, and passengers were transported by local school buses to the terminal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Bibles to Sneakers: The unusual Trump merch you can buy now
item.description: Donald Trump has diversified from real estate to sell various items including Bibles, sneakers, suit fragments, and coins with his image. Despite previous business failures like Trump University and Trump steaks, he continues marketing these products. These sales do not fund his campaign but use his likeness under a paid license.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Yahya Sinwar alive? Unsure Israel probes Hamas leader's death
item.description: The Israeli military is investigating if Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, associated with the October 7 attacks, is dead. Media reports suggest his possible death or injury in recent bombings, but Israeli intelligence lacks confirmation. Sinwar's past silence has led to false death claims before. This investigation coincides with Hamas rejecting a US-proposed hostage deal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Regional victory brings Germany's Scholz brief respite from growing pressure within party
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's Social Democrats narrowly defeated the far-right Alternative for Germany in Brandenburg's regional election. Despite this win, Scholz faces growing criticism within his party and declining national support. Tensions are rising within the coalition government due to poor performances by junior partners, adding to political instability.

item.title: Mayor of Muslim-majority Michigan city endorses Trump over Harris
item.description: Amer Ghalib, mayor of Hamtramck, a Detroit-area suburb with a Muslim majority, has endorsed Donald Trump for the 2024 presidential election. In a Facebook post written in Arabic, Ghalib expressed his belief that Trump is the right choice for this critical time. Polls indicate a challenging race ahead as Vice President Kamala Harris gains ground.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk plans five uncrewed Starship missions to Mars in two years
item.description: Elon Musk revealed that SpaceX is preparing to launch five uncrewed Starship missions to Mars in the next two years, aligning with the upcoming Earth-Mars transfer window. The success of these missions will determine when crewed flights can begin, potentially within four years if all goes well.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz to raise Kashmir, Palestine, Islamophobia issues at UNGA
item.description: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif is set to address the United Nations General Assembly on September 27. He will discuss issues including Jammu and Kashmir, Palestine, and rising Islamophobia. Last year, Pakistan highlighted Kashmir as essential for peace with India. India responded by calling for an end to cross-border terrorism and addressing human rights violations in Pakistan.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: 'There’s more to talk about': Kamala Harris has a message for Donald Trump; watch video
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris urged former President Donald Trump to engage in another debate on CNN next month. Despite Trump's refusal, citing ongoing voting, Harris emphasized the necessity of discussing issues and policies for American voters. With over a month remaining, she highlighted the race's closeness and her readiness for further debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Will Trump make another run for President if he loses in 2024? Here's what he said
item.description: Donald Trump, 78, has declared he will not seek another presidential bid if he loses the November 5 election against Kamala Harris. The competition is tight, with Harris making gains in national polls. Trump continues to allege voter fraud in his 2020 loss and faces criminal charges over efforts to overturn those results.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: GOP House speaker Mike Johnson axes Trump-backed bill linked to proof of citizenship for new voters
item.description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson presented a government funding bill without including the Save Act, which demands proof of citizenship for voter registration. The agreement extends funding until December 20, deferring further discussions until after the November 5 election. This move comes after an unsuccessful bid to merge voting provisions with a six-month funding extension.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Racial slur carved on student at Gettysburg College
item.description: Gettysburg College in Pennsylvania is investigating an incident involving two swim team members where a racial slur was scratched onto one student's chest during an informal gathering. The victim, who was later dismissed from the team, has not reported the matter to police. The college aims to turn this into a transformative moment for its community.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Coldplay India concert 2025: BookMyShow crashes minutes before tickets go live; IRCTC and other memes flood internet
item.description: Thousands of fans faced frustration as BookMyShow crashed just before Coldplay concert tickets went on sale. The British band will perform in Mumbai's DY Patil Stadium in January 2025, marking their return to India after eight years. An additional show has been added due to high demand despite the technical issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI Tech Desk

item.title: Charles did not like Diana's surprise Billy Joel dance, 'it was early sign of doomed marriage'
item.description: ​Anne Allan explained that there might be two reasons for Charles' displeasure. One, he's probably not a man who likes surprises; and two, probably he did not like his wife wearing a slinky dress, showing her body. " I’m not quite sure whether he thought it was the appropriate thing for Her Royal Highness the Princess of Wales."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kennedy Jr portrays himself as the victim, Olivia Nuzzi's camp pushes back in sexting row
item.description: Many people have spoken in favor of Olivia that she has been singled out while what allegedly happened between her and Kennedy Jr was not that uncommon. "Everyone in DC knows who everyone is hooking up with and that Olivia Nuzzi is not unique in her situation. Such fake outrage," Emma-Jo Morris, editor, Breitbart News said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Albania is planning a 'Vatican-style' sovereign enclave inside its capital
item.description: A Muslim cleric in Tirana, Albania, is set to lead what could become the world's smallest state, covering 27 acres and named the Sovereign State of the Bektashi Order. The enclave will promote religious tolerance and personal freedoms. Albanian PM Edi Rama supports this move to present a moderate version of Islam.

item.title: California law to protect children from social media addiction
Donald Trump says he won't run for president in 2028 if he loses this November
item.description: Trump spoke about the roles that the three bigwigs in his team will play if he wins -- Kennedy Jr, Elon Musk and Tulsi Gabbard. He said Bobby will do great on health and environment, Elon Musk will cuts the waste and the fat in the country and Tulsi is a common sense person who will do terrific in his administration. "I have not made ant deals with anybody," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's base in North Carolina divided over Robinson controversy
item.description: Trump supporters at a Wilmington rally were optimistic about his chances in North Carolina but divided over Lt. Gov. Mark Robinson's recent scandal involving past controversial comments. While some dismissed the allegations as media attacks, others expressed concern over their impact on his campaign. Many still supported Robinson for his political stance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gretchen Whitmer calls Trump 'deranged' over his abortion remarks
item.description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer criticized former President Donald Trump during a CNN interview, calling him 'deranged' for his recent comments on abortion. Trump claimed that women would be happier and healthier if he were re-elected. Whitmer argued that Trump does not understand the daily challenges faced by women in America.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Usher deletes all his X posts after 'wild things' claim about Diddy: 'Hacked or damage control?'
item.description: ​With Diddy going down, several pop stars are now at stake with their previous involvement with Diddy. Reports claimed Justin Bieber was also a victim of Diddy's sexual assault. An X user shared the video in question in which a relatively young Justin appears alongside the rapper as the two speak about Justin not staying in touch with him. The user wrote in his post, “A video of Diddy having 15yo justin bieber stuttering when he asked why they don’t hang out no more is resurfacing online (sic)”.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
